text: Hi all, I am new to HubSpot. I am trying to create a custom-coded drag and drop template. How to achieve this?
Hey - your best bet is reading the docs - they’re very thorough! <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started>
There is also a boilerplate the HubSpot team have put together - <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate>

I’m also quite new to HubSpot and find their documentation to be very helpful and descriptive. Just dive in into links provided by <@UQERM7BLY> and you find much everything needed.

I also would recommend go though HubSpot academy courses like this one

<https://app.HubSpot.com/academy/7813309/tracks/121/813/4127>
In case of authorization issues link in prev comment doesn’t work, here’s screenshot from HubSpot Academy
<@UJBDYC03D>, <@UMZFZHVUJ> as you work through this, would really be interested in your feedback about what works, doesn't etc.
Also, <@UQERM7BLY> is a freaking champ and people like him in this slack are what makes it great!
Rod!  So happy to see you!  Ask questions!  There are a ton of folks who walk that tight rope.

<@UD53A9UUR> the course was very helpful for me. It gave an overall glimpse on the HubSpot development. When documentation articles were a sort of dive in into detail on more specific level.

So my recommendation would be academy course first > documentation then.

I’m also practicing code rewriting technic. Manually writing code line by line from HS boilerplate or their default theme helps me understand and remember the structure and how things work inside.
